array.string: South Carolina acted first, calling for a convention to secede from the Union. State by state, conventions were held, and the confederacy was formed.

The Confederacy was established in the Montgomery Convention in February 1861 by seven states (South Carolina, Mississippi, Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, adding Texas in March before Lincoln's inauguration).
The decision was made to name the City of Richmond, Virginia as the new Capital of the Confederacy. Shortly thereafter, in recognition of Virginia's strategic importance.

The First Battle of Bull Run, also known as the Battle of Manassas, marked the first major land battle of the American Civil War. On July 21, 1861, Union and Confederate armies clashed near Manassas Junction, Virginia.
Jefferson Davis was elected president, not of the United States of America but of the Confederate States of America. He ran unopposed and was elected to serve for a six-year term.
US its first victory of the war,
The Battle of Fort Henry was fought in Donelson Middle Tennessee. It was the first important victory for the Union and Brig. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant in the Western Theater.
